description: Underground museum. Interior design by Sam Jacobs Studio. Design concept influenced by cartoon and comic narrative techniques.

factsheet.heading: About The Cartoon Museum
paragraphs: The Cartoon Museum champions cartoon and comic art, highlighting its importance to culture and society. Since 2006 it has received 420,000 visitors, and built a nationally important collection of 4,300 cartoons, comics and caricatures, and a library of 18,000 items.

The Cartoon Museum runs a well-attended school programme and sell-out school holiday workshops. Over 50,000 children and adults have attended cartooning, comic and animation workshops and the museum receives 3,000 student visits each year. The museum is a registered charity.

factsheet.heading: History of the Building
paragraphs: The Cartoon Museum moved to 63 Wells Street in July 2019. Originally an empty basement, the interior design work, handled by Sam Jacobs Studio, provided a new and unique setting for the museum collections.

location.address: The Cartoon Museum, 63 Wells St, W1A 3AE
travel_info: Tube: Oxford Circus, Tottenham Court Road, Goodge Street, Bond Street

name: The Cartoon Museum
